climbs.name: About a Rope
climbs.fa: M. Dixon, J. Graham (FA) P. Baker, T. Jellinek (FFA)

content.description:
P1:  Go up and slightly right around the huge block. Head straight up to the obvious ledge with the large tree with a sling. **Note: there is a sloped block below the face leading to the ledge... it MOVES! Watch your fingers and toes.  Also... the big block on which the slope block sits will move as well.  Be gentle and everything looks like it should stay put for quite some time. 
  
 P2: Traverse left off the ledge and head up a vertical crack system.

One Pitch: Most people climb it in a single pitch. Just avoid going on the ledge with the large tree and climb left of it aiming slightly left for the top mini-dihedral/crack feature. Make sure to use slings.

Start 50' left of the pyramid in the right-facing corner.
Standard rack is fine. Bolted anchor.

climbs.name: Incognito
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes, Steve Adamson and Joe Kennedy, 2017

content.description:
Start on the far left hand side of Pyramid Wall in a shallow corner.  Climb up the corner aiming for a bolt. After clipping second bolt move up to a small ledge then left across a horizontal crack. There is another bolt on a face off to the left - this is not part of the route! The horizontal crack leads to a diagonal crack going up and right. Follow this to another ledge. Once on the ledge step left to clip a second pin. Continue left then up between two colossal flakes. Stay mostly on the right flake. Be careful of where you place gear in the flake. Be patient as there is bomber gear above the flake. Continue up and slightly right of a big tree to finish on a bolted anchor. 


At the far left end of Pyramid Wall locate a broken corner. Start here and head relatively straight up navigating a series of flakes and ledges. Incognito follows a path between About a Rope and Trundle Flakes and finishes on it own ledge slightly above these routes.

Single rack to 3" piece. There are two pins and two bolts protecting run outs. Bolted rap station.

climbs.name: Khufu's Ladder
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes, Finley Corbett and Celeste Gaudet, August, 2021

content.description:
Pleasant climbing on cool features and interesting crack formations. 



Found on the far right hand side of Pyramid Wall called The King's Chamber. This is the middle line accessed from a nice ledge below a fixed rope that leads to the climbs Spiderman and Mr. Clean. 

Standard Welsford rack. Small cams protect the crux. Tree anchor. Rap the route.

climbs.name: The Last of the Unplucked Gems

content.description:
Steep start on a narrow rock but big holds and good feet. Continue up with a slight move left over the alcove then up to a slab. Navigate the slab to a headwall that leads to a large block with a bolted anchor. 



Found on the left hand side of Pyramid Wall. Just left of a high slabby buttress. Start on the narrow torpedo shaped block just right of the About a Rope Alcove.


Standard rack, doubles in finger sized cams would be nice but not absolutely necessary. Bolted anchor. Rap the route.

Climb the bolted blank face in the middle of the Pyramid to get to a few horizontal cracks. Continue straight up on the series of horizontal cracks that offer good pro placement. The difficulty eases after the blank face crux.

Middle of the pyramid.
2 bolts for the blank face and gear after. Bolted anchor. Make sure to have an attentive belayer clipping the 2nd bolt.

climbs.name: Mr. Clean
climbs.fa: Mitch LeBlanc, Yves Losier, Fred Berube 1994

content.description:
If this route did not have ledge fall potential it would be much better. That being said it is still ok just be sure to protect it well. 



Found on the right hand side accessed by going to the King's Chamber and then scrambling some 3rd class terrain to a large ledge. Mr. Clean is located in the corner to the left. 

Standard Welsford rack. Tree anchor. Rap the route.

Found in the King's Chamber. Scramble up a dirty sloping corner to a small flat area directly underneath a large arching roof. Locate the offwidth closest to the corner on the slab to your left. The start of the route is just right of the offwidth. Climb up and over the offwidth then continue straight up towards a large tree on a ledge.

The climbing on this is great but the location of the start detracts from the overall experience. 



Found in the King's Chamber. Scramble up a dirty sloping corner to a small flat area directly underneath a large arching roof. Locate the offwidth closest to the corner on the slab to your left. The start of the route is just right of the offwidth. Climb up and over the offwidth then continue straight up towards a large tree on a ledge. 

Standard Welsford rack. Tree anchor. Rap the route.

Climb edges to the gigantic, detached block.  You can clip the first bolt by standing on top of this block.  Stay right on the arête, and then climb left underneath a low & shallow bulge onto the face (tougher for taller climbers).  Climb straight up the face toward the second bolt, and then work your way back onto the arête by pulling a dirty ledge with a spruce tree.  Follow the slabby arête (passing one last bolt) to the ring anchors (shared with Tut's  Tomb).

The rightmost route on the (semi-detached/upper) King's Chamber face, which is climber's right of the distinguishable "Pyramid".
3 bolts and cams up to 1.5".  A crack or two will take a nut.

Start up the slabby open book corner aiming for a roof and dihedral. After moving through the dihedral go up and slightly right following a weakness. Aim for a lone bolt on a face. After clipping the bolt continue up to a horizontal crack and foot ledge. Continue up and slightly right to find more gear then move back left toward the Pass the Moonshine finish.



Located in the left hand section of Pyramid. This rout is the furthest line right that starts on the ground. Look for a corner crack that leads to a roof.


Single rack to 3 inch piece.1 bolt. Tree anchor. Rap the route.

Nice crack climbing and good gear.



Up and right of October Sky. Climb the low angle slab to the start of a crack on the face. Continue up a  series of discontinuous cracks to the top.

Single rack to 2" piece. Tree anchor. Rap the route.

Start up Puff the Magic Dragon until you reach the base of the large detached block.  Climb in front or behind the block aiming for the right trending ramp visible from the ground.  Continue along the ramp until it meets a short left trending crack make a few moves up this crack to join Pass the Moonshine on the top ledge.  A small scramble takes you to a tree anchor.

Note:  This route is G if you have a #5.



Shares a start with Puff the Magic Dragon.


Standard Rack (#5 will make it G instead of PG)

climbs.name: Pass the Moonshine
climbs.fa: J. DeVink, S. Hall, M. Leblanc (1994) FA & FFA

content.description:
Up the center of the bulge slab. Interesting step up move.. follow the right trending diagonal crack with the two trees in it. Follow the thin flaring vertical crack straight up to a chain on a tree. 
  
 While the second half is fun, the trees in the route lower the fun factor a bit.  Though they are great for quick sling pro...

Just left of the Pyramid, start in the middle of the rounded slab.
Can be done on all small passive gear, but small cams makes the send quicker.

Left of Pass the Moonshine, climb the slab then up face and ledges, trending right and aiming for a small roof split by a crack. Climb the roof and continue to the top of the cliff.

Just left of Pass the Moonshine. Look for a small roof split by a distinct crack about 2/3 of the way up the wall. That's what you are aiming for.
standard rack

Climb up the right side of a block. When you reach the horizontal crack, traverse right to the middle of the wall and finish up Montezuma's Revenge.
Climbing the route as described is very solid 5.10a. Many people however don't traverse right and continue up the obvious features on the left side of the pyramid. This makes for a much less contrived line but probably only clocks in at 5.6.

Left side of the Pyramid
standard rack

Crux is low on the route. Make hard moves to gain a cutout hold and the second bolt, then continue more easily to the top. Either make an anchor using one of the trees or traverse left to the bolted anchor for Montezuma's
note: be careful clipping the 2nd bolt as a ground fall would be likely.

right side of the pyramid feature.
2 bolts, a few medium cams

Suberb movement up a beautiful arete. Gear abounds but the crux, although easy, only protects with small cams. 



Found on the far right hand side of Pyramid Wall below a fixed rope that leads to a ledge containing Spiderman and Mr. Clean. 

Standard Welsford rack. Double up on small cams. Tree anchor. Rap the route.

Beauty line. Great movement. Good pro throughout. Classic. 



Located on a ledge left of The King's Chamber and just right of Mr. Clean. 

Standard Welsfor rack. Tree anchor. Rap the route.

Start on a nice vertical crack next to a Spruce tree. Climb that to a ledge then continue up a series of cracks and features to the top. 



Found on top of the Pyramid block above Montezumo's. Scramble up from the left or right side or climb any route below it. 

Single rack to #1 BD. Tree anchor. Rap the route.

Climb a small buttress to a ledge. Follow a shallow right-leaning ramp up and right to a face split by a thin crack. Up this face to easier climbing up and right. Head right near the top to the chain anchor on Puff the Magic Dragon. The original line goes to a tree left of Puff with no rap station and a large flake in front of the tree so this location would not be ideal to build an anchor and then have to rappel.  

A very fun route with interesting climbing.


middle of the left side of pyramid area
standard rack to 3". Tree anchor

From the ledge, climb up a face past a bolt to gain a crack with blocks. Move left to gain the vertical crack system and climb up between two huge flakes.

At the far left end of Pyramid Wall. Scramble up a short wall to a ledge with trees.
standard rack, 1 bolt, tree anchor

Climb up the middle of the King's Chamber face using the detached flake; the 1st bolt is placed above some thin edges above this flake.  Continue straight up using reachy crimpers and small foot edges. The top (crux) includes some shallow creases (i.e., slopers) that are covered with lichen.  
  
 This route is consistent 5.9 climbing with a 5.10-crux.

Middle of the King's Chamber face, which is climber's right of, and slightly elevated from,  the Pyramid Wall.
3 bolts and cams up to 1".

Looking for a splendid warm or a great first trad lead. This is it. A very nice variety of climbing and features on a suprisingly fun section of stone at Pyramid Wall. Fantastic gear, great movement. 



Located on the right side of the Pyramid face. Second route right of Montezumo's Revenge. Start on some big flakes that take you to a slab. Clip the bolt on the slab and then move up and slightly left. 

Single rack to BD #2. One protectection bolt. Rap the route or walk off.
So named because of the huge pyramid shaped block in the middle of this wall.  Many nice moderate trad climbs.
